text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with hot wheels that's right it's a
play on words but it's so much more than
that we are gonna use an assortment of
wheel shaped ingredients to create an
incredibly easy and very very delicious
spicy summer pasta and the first of
those ingredients is this Rotelli pasta
also known as wagon wheels also known as
mini wheels and then to put the heat in
the hot we're gonna use lots of peppers
all right I have an assortment of green
how a pan yo those are spicy red Fresno
chilies those are spicy and then we also
have some sweet yellow and orange
peppers and of course we want to keep
the metaphor rolling so what we're gonna
do is cut these in rings so we're not
gonna cut them in half and seed them
that would totally rack the desired
geometry so what we're gonna do is just
slice them across into fairly thin
slices and we do want to remove the
seeds and as you'll notice most of those
are gonna fall out while you're cutting
them the vast majority it's also quite
easy to poke out the center if it's a
little stubborn and by the way a few
seeds are not gonna bother you but if
you're concerned you could always give
them a dunk in water and those seeds
will separate from the flesh and kind of
settle to the bottom and as you fish
those rings out with your fingers they
will be fairly seed free and of course
the amounts in which peppers you use are
up to you you are the Lord of the Rings
so this was the assortment I used and I
got about three cups all right so our
peppers are prepped and it's out to the

we're gonna slice up some zucchini but
before we do let's pimp this ride a

zester but we're not gonna zest the
zucchini that would be ridiculous we're
gonna use the little tool on the side of
the zester that most people don't even
know you get with these tools it's
called a channel knife and if you drag
that along the side of a zucchini or a
cucumber or something like that it will
cut out a little channel like that and
we're gonna go all the way around and
you're gonna get these beautiful let's
call them racing stripes and then when
you slice it it just looks that much
more interesting so this step is
obviously optional but if you have a
zester I bet you have one of those

a try
and once those vegetables are prepped we
can head over to the stove and start the

to add a big splash of olive oil and yet
another wheel shaped ingredient some
sliced green onion
and we're just gonna sweat those for a

a pinch of salt but this time we're
gonna put in an anchovy filet that's
right those are very salty they're cured
with salt packed in olive oil and we're
just gonna saute that along with the
green onions for two or three minutes
it's gonna basically disappear and by
the way this is also safe for
vegetarians
since very very few of them will be able
to tell you put it in so we're gonna
sizzle the anchovy in the green onion
for a couple minutes just until the
onions soften a little and that
anchovies gonna kind of fall apart at
that point we're gonna dump in a whole

sizzle all right so keep it moving we're
gonna cook that for like I said about a
minute at that point we're gonna go
ahead and add our zucchini and we'll
cook that for a couple minutes until it
just just barely thinks about turning
tender and of course be careful we don't
want the garlic browning the zucchini
has a lot of moisture in it so that's
probably not gonna happen but to hedge
our bets here after we stirred around
for a minute or two let's go ahead and
add a big pinch of salt and I'm also
gonna add a little bit of pepper and
we'll give that a stir and cook that for
maybe another minute and like I said
we're just looking for the zucchini to
barely start to turn tender and one tip
the inside of the zucchini will go from
like a white to more of an off-white
color sort of tinged with green and
that's basically what I have right here
so at that point we're gonna stop and
we're gonna dump in our tomato sauce and

and then this sauce is simply gonna sit

you should be able to taste the salt and

seven we're gonna drain it we're gonna

ahead and add
are almost cooked Rotelli pasta we're

on the blog post your options for

where my peppers have a little bit of
texture to them they're not crisp but
they're certainly not soft all in all
you're probably gonna cook that pasta in
that sauce with the vegetables for about
two to three minutes and at that point
you should be looking at a beautiful pan

ahead and turn off the heat and then the

just a really beautiful summer pasta so
